column4: I am having problems boot from the usb flash drive. I use unetbootin and when I go to boot it just has a screen that says default I push enter and it just reloads the same screen
No
I downloaded an iso and I am trying to put it on a flash drive so I can install it.
or that too
try another menu option, unetbootin sometimes causes errors from the kernel on default
like what?
there are usually more than one option, and if this is an ubuntu cd, one of them should be try ubuntu or install ubuntu
unetbootin is designed to run linux iso's only. it specifically looks for the files in a linux iso.,
Which application should I use for a non linux iso?
to be honest, i have never had to do this. i can take a crack at it, but I am not certain if it can be done. i can do some quick research for you...
that would be awesome. I have been google searching for the last 45 minutes and my brain is going to explode. I have wine installed so maybe a windows application would work?
what version of windows is it>
Windows xp
i found a few. one is here: http://wintoflash.com/home/en/

otherwise here's my google: http://www.google.com/#hl=en&sugexp=tshc&cp=17&gs_id=40&xhr=t&q=install+windows+from+usb&qe=aW5zdGFsbCB3aW5kb3dzIGY&qesig=tjuKk_aL4ddGDJ35B6nnSQ&pkc=AFgZ2tkos5UkLpBHgIPAYaFNpZ2b1w7Ctty1_WQVmBsGJ2zdqBl9e3i5H3wDIIL0slD-kWJT8kii36puyWkPhNUw9Y2eAgq9pw&pq=put+windows+on+a+flash+drive&pf=p&sclient=psy&source=hp&pbx=1&oq=install+windows+f&aq=0&aqi=g5&aql=f&gs_sm=&gs_upl=&bav=on.2,or.r_gc.r_pw.&fp=b62454da27284b07&
I think I may have found something also with unetbootin-windows-248
awesome. so it is dooable from what i read, albeit a little tricky. but defenitely dooable.
grr I think this is just the windows version of unetbootin that will make a linux boot :(
ahh. well there are native windows progs for this job. it looks like wintoflash is your best bet.
thank you so much for your help :)
no prob bob. :)
